meanings.definition: A square or rectangular piece of fabric worn around the shoulders or head.
meanings.sent1: She draped the shawl over her shoulders to keep warm.
meanings.sent2: The colorful shawl matched her dress perfectly.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten played with the dangling fringe of the shawl.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed through the room, enveloped in the soft embrace of the shawl.
meanings.sent5: The intricate patterns on the shawl told a story of tradition and culture.

meanings.definition: To wrap oneself in a shawl for warmth or modesty.
meanings.sent1: She would shawl herself before stepping out into the chilly evening.
meanings.sent2: In the olden days, women would shawl themselves before attending gatherings.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally shawled himself with the curtain instead of the actual shawl.
meanings.sent4: The fog shawled the town in a mysterious cloak, hiding its secrets.
meanings.sent5: As the night fell, she shawled herself tightly, feeling the comfort of the familiar fabric.
